channel.title: StockHedges
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from StockHedges, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Macy's delays earnings release as it says employee hid up to $154 million in delivery expenses
item.description: Macy's delayed its results after it discovered an issue related to the reporting of delivery expenses.

item.title: Bitcoin Is Surging, and the IRS Is Watching Closer Than Ever
item.description: The IRS is stepping up oversight as bitcoin surges near $100,000. Tax audits and criminal cases are happening more often, and new rules starting next ...

item.title: Best Buy cuts full-year sales forecast due to softer demand for consumer electronics
item.description: Best Buy is waiting for a wave of shoppers to replace old devices and upgrade to new, higher-tech ones after an approximately two-year sales slump.

item.title: Dollar Hampered as Month-End Flows Neutralize Impact of Trump's Tariff Plans
item.description: The dollar traded steady against a basket of currencies and fell against the euro as month-end portfolio-rebalancing flows offset the positive impact ...

item.title: Federal Prosecutors Charge Star Bond Investor Ken Leech With Fraud
item.description: Leech was the chief investment officer at Franklin Templeton subsidiary Western Asset Management.

item.title: Winter Weather Lifts U.S. Natural Gas Futures
item.description: U.S. natural gas futures rose as prospects for a colder winter lift demand.

item.title: U.S. Stocks Trade Mixed
item.description: U.S. stocks were mixed, largely shrugging off President-elect Donald Trumpâ€™s latest tariff threat.

item.title: Abercrombie expects a strong holiday quarter as growth run continues
item.description: Abercrombie & Fitch is expecting a strong holiday shopping season, and the arrest of its former CEO Mike Jeffries for sex trafficking did not seem to ...

item.title: Dick's Sporting Goods posts robust holiday guidance
item.description: Dick's Sporting Goods posted cautious guidance earlier this year as it braced for the 2024 election, but it now expects sales to be better than expect...

item.title: Zoom surpasses expectations and calls for another quarter of single-digit growth
item.description: Zoom's business is still growing, but not nearly at the rate of expansion during the Covid-19 pandemic.
